Package part01

Class MapBasics

java.lang.Object
part01.MapBasics
public class MapBasics extends Object
This class demonstrates the basic operations of a Map. Implement each method in this class. You may assume that all given keys and values are non-null. Do not change the method signatures or fields, as these will be used by the automated tests. Resources: https://dev.java/learn/api/collections-framework/working-with-keys-and-values/ https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/util/Map.html https://doc.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/util/HashMap.html

  • Constructor Details

    • MapBasics

      public MapBasics()

  • Method Details

    • createMap

      public Map<String,String> createMap()
      Create and return a new Map that maps String keys to String values.

    • addEntry

      public void addEntry(Map<String,String> map, String key, String value)
      Add the given key/value pair to the given map.

    • getPopulations

      public Map<String,Integer> getPopulations()
      Returns a map that maps the names of the Nordic countries to their populations. The countries and their populations are: Denmark 5 894 687 Finland 5 587 442 Iceland 354 234 Norway 5 509 591 Sweden 10 261 767 Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nordic_countries, 9.8.2023

    • getValue

      public String getValue(Map<String,String> map, String key)
      Return the value associated with the given key in the given map. If the key is not in the map, return null.

    • hasKey

      public boolean hasKey(Map<String,String> map, String key)
      Return true if the given map contains the given key, false otherwise.

    • hasValue

      public boolean hasValue(Map<String,String> map, String value)
      Return true if the given map contains the given value, false otherwise.

    • addIfNotPresent

      public void addIfNotPresent(Map<String,String> map, String key, String value)
      Add the given key/value pair to the given map if the key is not already in the map.

    • removeEntry

      public void removeEntry(Map<String,String> map, String key)
      Remove the entry with the given key from the given map.
      Parameters:
      map - the map to remove the entry from
      key - the key of the entry to remove

    • countEntries

      public int countEntries(Map<String,String> map)
      Return the number of entries (key/value pairs) in the given map.
      Parameters:
      map - the map to count the entries in
      Returns:
      the number of entries in the map

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty(Map<String,String> map)
      Return true if the given map is empty, false otherwise.

    • largestValue

      public Integer largestValue(Map<String,Integer> map)
      Return the largest Integer value in the map. If the map is empty, return null.

    • sumOfValues

      public int sumOfValues(Map<String,Integer> map)
      Return the sum of all the Integer values in the map. If the map is empty, return 0.

    • combineMaps

      public Map<String,String> combineMaps(Map<String,String> map1, Map<String,String> map2)
      Combines the two maps into a single map. If a key is in both maps, the value from the first map is used. The method must create and return a new map. Neither of the two given maps should be modified.

    • incrementValues

      public void incrementValues(Map<String,Integer> map, int amount)
      Increments all the values in the given map by the given amount. This method should modify the given map, not create a new one.
